item.title: Fentanil | China asks the US to stop blaming Beijing for the epidemic
item.description: China yesterday asked the United States to blame the Chinese for the fentanyl epidemic in the country and criticized the “irrational” customs imposed by Washington. "If the United States wants to sincerely cooperate with China, they should stop defaming and blaming China and get involved in a dialogue based on equality, respect and mutual benefit," said China's Foreign Ministry spokesman Lin Jian at a press conference. The US has been responsible for China because it is the country of manufacture of most of the chemicals that come in the United States. Fentanil is a powerful synthetic opioid that has become a public health problem in the United States in recent years, being responsible for tens of thousands of deaths annually. On Monday, US representative for trade, Jamieson Greer, revealed that the Fentanil crisis had been first approached in commercial talks between the United States and China. Contacts between the two countries have taken place since the weekend in Geneva. The issue of Fentanil has been one of the main points of the tariff confrontation between the two powers, with Washington asking Beijing to suppress the illegal production and export of chemicals that allow the manufacture of the substance. Asked yesterday about the perspectives of dialogue on the subject, Lin Jian said China was proactive, but was not responsible for the crisis. "The United States ignored China's goodwill and imposed irrational tariffs on Fentanil. This seriously impairs dialogue and cooperation between China and US in the fight against drugs and severely undermines China's interests," he said.

item.title: Trade War | Protected US operators
item.description: Macao government leader Sam Hou Fai assured yesterday that he will protect US casinos operators in the region in case of worsening the trade war between Beijing and Washington. "The six gaming operators have followed the Macao law. Since, following the law, these operators develop their businesses, healthily, they are certainly protected and supported by the government," said the chief executive. "We always welcome a good liking foreign investment," including "US capital investments, they are all welcome," said Sam. The government leader was speaking at a Six -Day Balance Sheet Conference to Macao from the Chinese Communist Party's leading manager for the affairs of the two semi -autonomous regions, Xia Baolong. On Monday, the Director of the Hong Kong and Macau Affairs Office, under the protection of the State Council, the Chinese executive, asked 20 local entrepreneurs to "work together to promote national prosperity." After this meeting, the secretary for Macau's economy and finance told reporters that Xia Baolong also appealed to the unit against "the increase in unilateralism and commercial protectionism in the United States." “Hong Kong and Macao entrepreneurs have to be united and put themselves on the same side of the state. In this situation, there is no way out if we make commitments and concessions,” said Anton Tai Kin IP. The leader spoke shortly before China and the United States announced an agreement on Monday, with effect from today, under which they will reduce mutual customs rights by 115 percentage points for 90 days. That is, United States Customs Rights on Chinese imports will be 30 percent during this period compared to 10 percent from China for US imports.

item.title: Macau maintains shipping by air to the United States
item.description: The Macau Post Office Director told Lusa yesterday that, unlike neighboring Hong Kong, the region kept ordering orders to the United States (USA), but only by air. On May 2, the US government eliminated the exemption of customs rights on small orders from mainland China and Hong Kong, such as those sent by the giants of Electronic Trade Shein and Temu. "In practice, now Macau is not included and the mail [which] goes to the United States is walking, except maritime. The rest, we keep normal," said Derby Lau Wai Meng. The Director of Post and Telecommunications Services (CTT) explained that the shipping of any goods, from sea to the US, implies a passage through Hong Kong, one of the busiest ports in the world. That is, there is only the hypothesis of sending orders by air, confirmed Derby Lau. "This case is sensitive," admitted the leader. "I think it's better not to talk [this subject], because the best thing is not to remember us," he added. Trump in Action The end of the exemption of customs rights on small orders from mainland China and Hong Kong emerged in an executive order, signed by US President Donald Trump on April 2. The document asked the US Secretary of Commerce, Howard Lutnick, to submit a report, within 90 days, if the end of the exemption should also cover Macao, "to avoid escape to these measures." On April 16, Hong Kong's post office announced the suspension of sending orders to the United States in response to the imposition, "abusive", tariffs by US authorities. A presidential decree issued by Donald Trump, still in the first term, in 2020, eliminated the preferential treatment granted to Hong Kong. The ancient British colony is therefore also affected by the 145 percent surcharge imposed on China. Chinese Communist Party's main official for Hong Kong and Macao affairs and governments of both regions accused the United States of imposing tariffs in mid -April to sabotage China. Macao Executive leader Sam Hou Fai criticized the United States for the “abusive imposition of customs taxes on all his business partners,” including China, “under various pretexts”. Yesterday, the US representative for the United States, Jamieson Greer, said Washington and Beijing will suspend the majority of customs rights and negotiate for 90 days. In the negotiations made in Geneva, the United States and China agreed to reduce the reciprocal customs rights imposed on each other, passing Chinese imports to pay a 30 percent customs right, while US products will pay a 10 percent customs right.

item.title: OCHRE SPACE | Displayed in Lisbon unpublished images of historical performance of Chinese art
item.description: The exhibition “To Add One Meter to Anonymous Mountain” is inaugurated this Tuesday in Lisbon, 30 years after the decisive performance for the Chinese Vanguard Art, announced the Ochre Space gallery, which reveals all existing images. “To add one to be anonymous mountain” (“add a meter to an anonymous mountain”, today is the testimony in photography and video of the 'performance' undertaken by ten artists from the community known as Beijing East Village, who decided to challenge not only the height of Mount Miaofeng, outside Beijing, but also the system, with a 'performance' to the models. traditional. On May 11, 1995, the ten artists gathered to increase by one meter the height of Mount Miaofeng, the Taihang mountains, with their own naked bodies, stacked, inert, in an action recorded in images. The final photograph gained international dimension after being presented at the 1999 Venice Art Biennial, becoming part of collections of institutions such as Tate Gallery in London, the Seattle Museum of Art and the New York Model Museum of Modern Art (MoMA). All images Ochre Space, however, promises to go further and “show them all - but all! - The photographs of the famous 'performance',” as Curator João Miguel Barros told Lusa. “To add one to be anonymous mountain” in Lisbon, according to the show's presentation text, brings together the full performance of 'performance' documentation, which includes unpublished images and the amateur video made at the time, allowing you to understand the full sequence of the action, their nature and collective complexity. The exhibition results from a two -year curator investigation, which involved conversations with nine of the ten performance artists, as well as with photographers, curators, collectors and academics, seeking to “cast new light on the artistic community of the East Village de Beijing” and revive the debate caused by the work, which followed the presentation at the 1999 Venice Biennial. Along with “To Add One Meter to Anonymous Mountain” is also presented in Lisbon the exhibition “Rongrong’s East Village”, dedicated to Rongrong, “One of China's main photographers, who documented the daily community of the community“ Rongrong’s Diary: Beijing East Village ”. The Beijing East Village community, which took over as an artistic movement in the early 1990s, emerged in the east of the Chinese capital after the Tiananmen Square protests in 1989. Among its elements are the ten creators of “To Add One Meter to Anonymous Mountain”: Cang Xin, Duan Yingmei, Gao Yang, Ma Liuming, Ma Zongyin, Wang Shihua, Zhang Binbin, Zhu Ming and Zuoxiao Zuzhou, and Zhang Huan, recurrently identified as responsible for the project. Under the exhibition will be edited the investigation of curator and photographer João Miguel Barros, with documentation and interviews, about the origins and the legacy of 'performance'. Ochre Space also made a limited edition of the final photograph of “To Add One Meter to Anymous Mountain”, in a partnership with Cang Xin, one of the project artists. The exhibition is evident until June 21.

item.title: Satellite Casinos | Deputies question the placement of workers and the game tables
item.description:
It was more than an hour to discuss the issue of satellite casinos: yesterday, in hemiciclo, the deputies demanded concrete data and answers about the eventual closure of these casinos, the situation of the workers and the relocation of the gaming tables. The Secretary for Economics and Finance, Tai Kin IP, said the government is prepared and that it is up to the dealers to negotiate with eventual exits or changes in positions with workers
The “rice bowl” or the “ours ours of the daily” rice of the satellite casinos that can close doors should be guaranteed. The government says it is prepared for workers to be left out of employment, but the deputies questioned yesterday the secretary for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP, in the Legislative Assembly (AL), demanding more concrete information. Tai Kin IP said that "the deputies said here a word:" If ". The government made a plan according to that same word:" if ". The details of this same plane were not advanced, and the ruler was stressed that “in relation to the transition of the satellite casinos, the concessionaires have to negotiate with the workers, in the case of a commercial situation, and the government will make efforts to help and coordinate. The government responds to this 'if' only depending on the real situation,” he said. There were 12 questions in the first round, to which Tai Kin IP replied that "sufficient assessment covers the situation of the operation of the satellite casinos and surrounding stores, as well as the situation of workers, including croupiers." "We are well prepared for this, and we have dominated the matter. There are three years for the transition and the rules are well established. It is up to the dealers to negotiate with casinos-satellite workers and the government will play the coordination role of all parties. We are evaluating the needs of stores in surrounding areas, because we want to create a favorable environment for SMEs," he said. And the game tables? The first deputies to intervene about this article were Leong Sun Iok, José Pereira Coutinho and Leong Hong Sai, who also questioned the increase of non -resident workers. Leong Sun Iok raised a point about the furniture: what will be done with the gaming tables if the casino-satellite close. “How will they be distributed, will they be relocated to other casinos, or will other measures be adopted?” He asked. Also the deputy Angela Leong, belonging to the Board of Directors of the Macao Games Society (SJM) Resorts, left a suggestion, taking into account his "experience": "Each game table needs seven to eight workers, and if this table goes to another concessionaire, workers can" follow "this company. This way, which is that the workers follow the table. ” Deadlines were also questioned for effective measures and if there is already a consensus on the number of satellite casinos to close, of the total of the 11 existing ones. Ella Law, linked to the Federation of Macao Workers Associations (Faom), said that "it must be done deeply about the situation so that workers can protect their rice bowl." "How will the game tables be distributed, if there are no satellite casinos that do not continue to work? It is not after existing dismissed workers who will think about their transfer to other companies or their work conversion," he said. The deputy said that "workers are restless and feel in a passive situation," there is "a lot of instability." Already Ngan Iek Hang said that there is thinking about the issue of workers distributed by three blocks, namely "those related to the concessionaires, those who are on the outsourcing basis and those linked to management positions." "If satellite casinos cease to exist, how do you keep the job post and every day bread? There are families where the couple works in the satellite casinos and their children will suffer," he said.

item.title: Joey Lao calls for more action in the development of hengqin
item.description: The time for compliance and passive and merely observant attitude has come to an end. This is how the President of the Macao Economic Association, Joey Lao, sees the way for the Executive of the Masters Finds Hengqin and the deepened cooperation zone. The former deputy and economist argues that the Macao government has to surpass the "observer" attitude towards hengqin issues and actively participate in national governance, treating the development of the deepened cooperation zone as if they were building their own home. The idea of ​​an opinion article signed by the former deputy and published yesterday in the newspaper or Mun, following the inspection visit to Macao from the Director of the Cabinet for Hong Kong and Macau affairs to the Council of State, Xia Baolong, which ended yesterday. During the passage through Macao, the Communist Party representative of China stressed that the Government of the MSAR should face the development of Hengqin as its subject, as a priority of local politics. Joey Lao pointed out that Macau has to break systematic barriers, promote complementary advantages and seek integration with Mountain Island to create a new space that boosts Macao's strong development. The former deputy recalled that during President XI's visit to Hengqin at the end of last year, the Chinese leader stressed the need to achieve substantive results from the deepened cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macao in Hengqin at the level of economic diversification of masters and the quality of life and convenience of residents living and/or working in Hengqin. On the other hand In the face of the complex international conjuncture, Joey Lao considers that Macau should adopt a broader and longer perspective. "Mand and all sectors of society need to reinforce the country's defense conscience, love to Macau and to be prepared to face dangers," says the former legislator without specifying. The economist also addressed what he calls “deep contradictions in the economy” and the industrial capacity of Macao, noting that they have long been subsisting without resolution, making the challenges and risks to the level of economic development unavoidable. Situations that cannot be ignored. Still on the idea of ​​Macao facing Hengqin as his own home, Au Kam San shared on Facebook a disagreeing opinion from Xia Baolong. The former deputy understands that for Macao to treat Hengqin's development as a local subject, its own sphere, mountain island should be fully ceded to masters. Au Kam San exemplified asymmetries with the fact that Hengqin Gross Domestic Product has no relationship with Macau, as well as the tax revenues on the other side of the border, where it is not possible to offer jobs to Macao residents with salaries that correspond to the Life Standards of the Masters. The former deputy also warns of the possibility of Macao suffered economically, unable to diversify, applying too much investments in Hengqin, neglecting the local economy.

item.title: June, month of Portugal | Exhibitions, Music and Gastronomy animate Macau
item.description:
Portugal's Day will be celebrated in June with exhibitions, movie shows, concerts, books and a lot of Portuguese cuisine. Due to legislative elections in Portugal, and subsequent formalities of inauguration of the new government, the President of the Republic will celebrate in Macau the month of Portugal in the second half of the year
May is still halfway, but already smells of June, which celebrates June 10, Portugal, Camões and Portuguese communities. As a habit, the celebrations will extend throughout the month. The program of the festivities of “June, Portugal Month in the MSAR” was presented yesterday at the Portuguese General Consulate in Macao and Hong Kong. Macao will celebrate Portuguese with varied exhibitions, concerts, workshops, book launch, lectures, gastronomic events and traditional celebrations, such as the flag raising in the consulate's Chancellery, the Camões Cave, the reception to the community in the official residence of Bela Vista and the St. Anthony Arraial at Macau Portuguese school. This year, the presence in Macao of the President of the Republic, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, was scheduled to celebrate June 10. However, the Portuguese political agenda marked by the next weekend's legislative elections dictated the postponement of the visit to Macau, which also stirred the June month program of Portugal, which included events with Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa. "I am sure that we will have the President of the Republic between us this year and, in the end, this will be a second phase of June month of Portugal," said Alexandre Leitão, adding that the events that included the participation of the head of state "will be held later." The consul did not want to risk the forecast of a precise date for the visit of Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa to the territory, shooting for the second half of the year, surely after summer, taking into account political commitments, such as taking office of the new government. Animated days The celebrations start later this month, with three exhibitions. From May 29, will be evident at Gallery Amagao, Artyzen Grand Lapa, the show “Portuguese Art - Creativity Dialogue”, which presents a selection of works by 24 Portuguese contemporary artists. Among the authors represented, highlight for Júlio Pomar, Graça Morais, Cunha Nery, José Luís Tinoco, Nurse, Alfredo Luz and Maria Dulce Martins. The organization of the event describes the exhibition as “a vibrant celebration of contemporary art that not only illuminates the artistic scene in Portugal, but also causes reflections on the issues that connect us and differentiate us in current society. The next day, May 30, the highlight goes to the photography exhibition by Francisco Ricarte “Somos - Images of Lusophony 2025 -“ The Man and the Divine ”, which will be evident in the 3306 store of the 3rd floor of Parisian Macau. The exhibition is organized by Somos - Portuguese Language Communication Association. On May 31, the general consulted general of Portugal and Hong Kong is the photography exhibition “Cultural Heritage of Macau”, which shows the public the photographic collection of the International Institute of Macao. The collection “has been annually enriched with dozens of new photographs submitted to the“ Discovery of Macao and Hengqin ”contest, organized by the Institute. The event will also include the viewing of the Trilingual documentary "Heritople", held by António Sanmarful Rooms, which highlights "the importance of cultural heritage and its experiences" in Macao, through a series of interviews. Full walls The “June, Portugal Month in the Hand” program presents several opportunities to enjoy exhibitions and movies. On June 3, Casa Garden will host the exhibition “Objects with Soul - Portuguese puppets”, which has the curated by Elisa Vilaça. The show results from a selection of the curator's personal estate, which has "about 1,000 puppets, representative of various continents and almost all types of manipulation." On June 11, the Rui Cunha Foundation Gallery exhibits “Metamorphoses - Individual Exhibition of Art by Lúcia Lemos”, a set of “44 pieces that link different artistic expressions and aesthetics, such as engraving, photography, installation, painting and ceramic”. Also in the exhibition, the headquarters of Casa de Portugal in Macao presents, from June 24, and photography exhibition “Macau - days from yesterday and days of today”. Make movies The film events of this year's program, in addition to the mentioned documentary “Heritople”, starts on June 4 with the screening of the documentary film “Metamorphosis”, held by António Luís Moreira, in the Gallery of the Rui Cunha Foundation. "Metamorphosis" follows the "stories of three villages whose lives reflect the widest social mutations of modernity." The film, aired from 6.30 pm, portrays the depopulation, the tenacity of the people and the collective identity in three “shale villages” of the municipality of Góis. The next day, June 5, Portugal Bookstore shows at 6.30 pm the documentary “Small Worlds in Solid State”, by Claudia Falcão. However, the cherry in the cinematic cake will be the 7th Portuguese Film Show in Macao da Portugal Film, which will take place between June 20 and 22. From the screen for the dish, the month of Portugal in the sgas again bet strong in Portuguese cuisine. Throughout the month, Lusa food will be celebrated in the “gastronomic script - eat and drink to the Portuguese”. The third edition of the event will be attended by 29 establishments, including “Fine Dining” restaurants, more traditional restaurants, coffee shops and bars, a record number for the event. Customers of the 29 adherent establishments will benefit from a 10.6 percent discount (June 10) and those who pay with a BNU credit card, or by BNU Pay application, qualifies to gain a trip to Portugal to two people. In addition, at the end of the script, a meal will be drawn for two people. This year will be offered a “exclusive selection of the best Portuguese delicacies”, including a variety of cheese, Iberian ham Bellota, homemade handcrafted breads, cod, alheira balls, butterfly cream pastels and 30 wines from nine Portuguese regions. Notes and Pages As there is no party without music, this year's program of “June, Portugal's month” will bring several opportunities to enjoy live music. Starting with the Joana Rolo piano recital at the Military Club on June 6, at 7:30 pm. The concert has as “inspiration” the trips and stays abroad of Portuguese composers, a muse that gives the goal of leading the pianist to play in China. "The idea is that she also acts in other cities in China, in partnership with other embassies and consulates. It's important, but it's not easy to do. Unfortunately, we can't plan things in a long time and tell me that in China we need to present the projects well in advance so to be approved," said Alexandre Leitão yesterday. Despite the conditions, the objective remains. "We want to try, more and more, that someone who comes here to act can then act in the region," added the diplomat. Two days later, on June 8, the Rui Cunha Foundation hosts the concert “Vocalini, let's sing the opera”, which brings together singer Elvire de Paiva and Pona and pianist Joana Rolo. Literary sessions will serve as an appetizer for the following dinners. The romage is followed by the cave of Camões, in Jardim Camões. "The entrance is open to all the Portuguese, but we ask people to make a pre-registration, so that we can manage the interior space in case there is a lot of influx," said Alexandre Leitão, stressing that the event is not subject to invitation. The celebration program also features the Arraial de Santo António on June 14 and 15 at the Portuguese School of Macau, with the usual concerts, games and food and drink, workshops throughout the month and lectures/seminars dedicated to business.

item.title: Commerce | Chief Executive wants more Lusophone investors
item.description:
Sam Hou Fai, chief executive, said yesterday that Macau intends to attract more investors from countries where Portuguese is spoken, in order to streamline the local economy and promote the longed for “economic diversification”
Macao government leader Sam Hou Fai said today that the region wants to attract more foreign investors, including Portuguese -speaking countries. At a press conference, the chief executive said that the territory has to “welcome foreign friends to invest in Macau and also to realize his dreams in Macao”, especially in the area of ​​advanced technology. Sam Hou Fai stressed that "they can come from Portuguese and Spanish-speaking countries", because "as long as they are in favor of economic diversification, they are always welcome," he added. Sam argued that local entrepreneurs should "explore Spanish and Portuguese language markets and Africa markets and the Middle East." The chief executive stressed that this is “the role of Macao on the international stage”, awarded by the Chinese central government. “We have to know what our advantages are and promote our course of development abroad,” said Sam. Visit to Portugal in July In a statement issued Monday night, the leader had already appealed to the city's industrial and commercial sector to "attract more investments from foreign capital and concentrate on Macao more resources [human] of high quality." Local entrepreneurs should “take full advantage of the unique role and unique advantages of Macao to“ actively explore priority markets, such as those of Portuguese -speaking countries, ”added the government leader. On April 14, Sam said he will visit Portugal after the May 18 legislatures, but offered no solution to restrictions on the Portuguese residence in the region. Macau has not accepted since August 2023 new requests for residence for Portuguese, for the “exercise of specialized technical functions”, allowing only justification of family meeting or previous connection to the territory. The Portuguese remains the issuance of a 'Blue Card', a limited authorization to the labor bond, without the benefits of residents, namely at the level of health or education. Yesterday the government leader said that the visit to Portugal "should be in July" and could include a time in Spain, "to find more development projects between Macau and these countries." Sam said the Macao delegation will include entrepreneurs from the region's industrial, commercial and financial sectors and "even certain companies in the interior of China."

item.title: History | Launched Chinese edition of the book by Manuel V. Basilio
item.description:
It's called “Stories and Memories-Baixo do Monte and surroundings”, it is a book by Manuel V. Basilio and its edition in Chinese will be released on May 19 at the headquarters of the Macao Retired, Retired and Pensioners Association (Apomac). The work, presented in 2023, now wins a new version and has a preface by Lok Po, director of the newspaper or Mun
It will be released next Monday, 19, the Chinese edition of another book by Manuel V. Basil, a retired teacher who has been dedicated to various investigations into the history of Macau. This time, this is the book “Stories and Memories-Baixo do Mount and surroundings”, already presented in its Portuguese version in 2023, and now has preface by Lok Po, director of the newspaper or Mun. The launch runs at the headquarters of Apomac - Macao's Retired, Retired and Pensioners Association. According to a statement from Apomac, since the first launch of the work that “several people encouraged the author to also edit a Chinese language version, given the interest that may be with the Chinese community in the dissemination of one of the most striking periods in the history of Macao - the integration of the Chinese population in the so -called 'Christian city'”, when the effective miscegenation of western and eastern crops created the barrier created by the old wall and doors of the city, all living in harmony as neighbors ”. We were in the mid -nineteenth century. More specifically, from 1844, the Portuguese administration "authorized all foreigners to buy or build houses and have any terrain in Macao." Thus, "this measure eventually favored years later, the Chinese traders who had some wealth and came to Macao from southern China to escape the Taiping rebellion, also known as the Taiping Civil War, which lasted from 1850 to 1864, having settled here and restarts their activities as entrepreneurs."
According to the same note, the end of the separation between the so -called Christian city and the zone in which the Chinese community lived was thanks “to the end of the coexistence of two jurisdictions in the Macao Peninsula - the Portuguese and the Chinese, respectively, inside and outside the city's wall that, over centuries, separated the two communities”. It was also fundamental for this new phase “the beginning of the so -called colonial period, in which the Portuguese government had territorial autonomy throughout the peninsula to the door door, which later became known as the siege door”. Election zones Where did the Chinese were installed when the end of this separation between communities and modes of life? The book describes that "one of the zones preferred by the Chinese traders to reside was precisely the one that was then designated by low of the mount, because it is near the heart of the city." "Since then some names of public roads have changed by the desire of their residents. Do you know, by chance, the old name of Travessa dos Anjos? And the reasons why it was changed, and what was the old method used to give names to public roads? Did you know that some Chinese were also awarded with honorific titles by the Portuguese court, and that these titles had an expiration date for one or two lives?" in the note. To all these curiosities and historical facts the book of Manuel V. Basilio intends to respond. In the case of Baixa do Monte, and according to the information available in the “register of public roads and other places of the city of Macau, 1957, it was a designation for“ the southern hill slope and covering an entire area, vaguely defined, ranging from Fortaleza to the nearby streets of Palha, S. Domingos and Pedro Nolasco da Silva, between Rua de S. Paulo and Calçada do Monte ”. This was an area “where many Portuguese and macanese families lived”, and to prove this fact, Manuel V. Basil “collected data on several families, especially macanese, who resided in that city from the mid -nineteenth century to the second half of the twentieth century, and whose collection includes, in particular, Baptist, Baptist, Valoma, Marques, Xavier families, Crestejo, medicines, Lopes, Morais, Nogueira, Simões, Cameirão, Costa, Silva, Fernandes, Souza, Pires, Gonçalves, Jorge, Eusébio, Placé, Osório, Santos, Rosario and Martins ”. From 1963, there are families who lived in blocks 3 and 4 of “Kwok Wá Tai Há”, ie “Capitol neighborhood”, next to the sidewalk of truths, and “formed, for decades, an authentic community neighborhood of Macanese”. Currently "just a few macanese reside there." Biographies and titles But not only of streets speaks this book. The author also wrote summarized biographies of some individuals and Chinese traders who lived in downtown Mount, namely Chou Iau and Fong Seng, who, in 1880, were awarded the title of Knight by the honorary mercy of King D. Luís I of Portugal, due to the valuable contributions they made to Macau's economic and social life. The author also makes a brief description of the divinity on the Tcha, the temple dedicated to him, along with the sidewalk of truths, as well as the festivities in his honor that are held annually on the 18th day of the fifth month of the lunar calendar. It also makes a brief summary of the history of some buildings that existed and others that still exist, located in the boundary zone of Baixa do Monte, including the Capitol Theater building, since its inauguration, on April 18, 1931 until its closing, on August 1, 1987, and its later requalification, which became the “Capitol Theater Shopping Center”. Thus, “Stories and Memories - Baixa do Mount and surroundings” includes “Memories, Experiences, Uses and Customs, as well as stories based on the history of Macao”, as well as valuable information about the toponymy of some Macao zones and their history.

item.title: Macau maintains shipping by air to the United States
item.description: The Macau Post Office Director told Lusa yesterday that, unlike neighboring Hong Kong, the region kept ordering orders to the United States (USA), but only by air. On May 2, the US government eliminated the exemption of customs rights on small orders from mainland China and Hong Kong, such as those sent by the giants of Electronic Trade Shein and Temu. "In practice, now Macau is not included and the mail [which] goes to the United States is walking, except maritime. The rest, we keep normal," said Derby Lau Wai Meng. The Director of Post and Telecommunications Services (CTT) explained that the shipping of any goods, from sea to the US, implies a passage through Hong Kong, one of the busiest ports in the world. That is, there is only the hypothesis of sending orders by air, confirmed Derby Lau. "This case is sensitive," admitted the leader. "I think it's better not to talk [this subject], because the best thing is not to remember us," he added. Trump in Action The end of the exemption of customs rights on small orders from mainland China and Hong Kong emerged in an executive order, signed by US President Donald Trump on April 2. The document asked the US Secretary of Commerce, Howard Lutnick, to submit a report, within 90 days, if the end of the exemption should also cover Macao, "to avoid escape to these measures." On April 16, Hong Kong's post office announced the suspension of sending orders to the United States in response to the imposition, "abusive", tariffs by US authorities. A presidential decree issued by Donald Trump, still in the first term, in 2020, eliminated the preferential treatment granted to Hong Kong. The ancient British colony is therefore also affected by the 145 percent surcharge imposed on China. Chinese Communist Party's main official for Hong Kong and Macao affairs and governments of both regions accused the United States of imposing tariffs in mid -April to sabotage China. Macao Executive leader Sam Hou Fai criticized the United States for the “abusive imposition of customs taxes on all his business partners,” including China, “under various pretexts”. Yesterday, the US representative for the United States, Jamieson Greer, said Washington and Beijing will suspend the majority of customs rights and negotiate for 90 days. In the negotiations made in Geneva, the United States and China agreed to reduce the reciprocal customs rights imposed on each other, passing Chinese imports to pay a 30 percent customs right, while US products will pay a 10 percent customs right.

item.title: OCHRE SPACE | Displayed in Lisbon unpublished images of historical performance of Chinese art
item.description: The exhibition “To Add One Meter to Anonymous Mountain” is inaugurated this Tuesday in Lisbon, 30 years after the decisive performance for the Chinese Vanguard Art, announced the Ochre Space gallery, which reveals all existing images. “To add one to be anonymous mountain” (“add a meter to an anonymous mountain”, today is the testimony in photography and video of the 'performance' undertaken by ten artists from the community known as Beijing East Village, who decided to challenge not only the height of Mount Miaofeng, outside Beijing, but also the system, with a 'performance' to the models. traditional. On May 11, 1995, the ten artists gathered to increase by one meter the height of Mount Miaofeng, the Taihang mountains, with their own naked bodies, stacked, inert, in an action recorded in images. The final photograph gained international dimension after being presented at the 1999 Venice Art Biennial, becoming part of collections of institutions such as Tate Gallery in London, the Seattle Museum of Art and the New York Model Museum of Modern Art (MoMA). All images Ochre Space, however, promises to go further and “show them all - but all! - The photographs of the famous 'performance',” as Curator João Miguel Barros told Lusa. “To add one to be anonymous mountain” in Lisbon, according to the show's presentation text, brings together the full performance of 'performance' documentation, which includes unpublished images and the amateur video made at the time, allowing you to understand the full sequence of the action, their nature and collective complexity. The exhibition results from a two -year curator investigation, which involved conversations with nine of the ten performance artists, as well as with photographers, curators, collectors and academics, seeking to “cast new light on the artistic community of the East Village de Beijing” and revive the debate caused by the work, which followed the presentation at the 1999 Venice Biennial. Along with “To Add One Meter to Anonymous Mountain” is also presented in Lisbon the exhibition “Rongrong’s East Village”, dedicated to Rongrong, “One of China's main photographers, who documented the daily community of the community“ Rongrong’s Diary: Beijing East Village ”. The Beijing East Village community, which took over as an artistic movement in the early 1990s, emerged in the east of the Chinese capital after the Tiananmen Square protests in 1989. Among its elements are the ten creators of “To Add One Meter to Anonymous Mountain”: Cang Xin, Duan Yingmei, Gao Yang, Ma Liuming, Ma Zongyin, Wang Shihua, Zhang Binbin, Zhu Ming and Zuoxiao Zuzhou, and Zhang Huan, recurrently identified as responsible for the project. Under the exhibition will be edited the investigation of curator and photographer João Miguel Barros, with documentation and interviews, about the origins and the legacy of 'performance'. Ochre Space also made a limited edition of the final photograph of “To Add One Meter to Anymous Mountain”, in a partnership with Cang Xin, one of the project artists. The exhibition is evident until June 21.

item.title: Venice receives “Parallel Worlds”, from Macao, at the Architecture Biennial
item.description: It was inaugurated last Thursday, in Venice, at the 19th Biennial of Architecture, the show “Parallels”, which represents Macao at the Biennial and which is a project carried out by photographer Iwan Baan with architectural students at the University of St. Joseph (USJ). The curatorship is still with Wang Shu, the last Pritzker award, and Lu Wenyu. This is a show that reveals the coexistence of “parallel worlds” in Macao, combining “Macao urban landscape images captured by the famous humanistic architecture photographer Iwan Baan and facilities created by teachers and students from the Faculty of Architecture of the China Academy of Arts and the Faculty of Architecture and Design at the University of São José de Macao”. Thus, it is represented “the urban fabric of the city where Chinese and Western cultures, old and new styles have coexisting for over 400 years,” says a note from the Cultural Institute (IC). There are, in this show, four “parallel worlds”, namely “the deep space of the historic city, the hotel architecture that embodies the merger between East and West, the geometric order of the modern city, representing its vibrant development; and the future projection of a digitized and intangible city, which defines an innovative view for Macau”. Reveal the heritage According to the IC, "through aerial photography and a unique perspective, Iwan Baan demonstrated the relationship between architecture, urban landscape and the natural environment of Macau, being highly engaging and narrative." "Young people from the colleges of architecture in the interior of China and Macao brought to the exhibition several creative facilities that provide ideas for the future development of Macao's urban architecture." Leong Wai Man, president of the IC, said in his speech in Venice that "world cultural heritage focused on the historic center of Macau and the modern buildings around the city show the harmony between the past and the present, constituting a vivid representation of the integration of Chinese and Western cultures," this exposure in Venice "reflects exactly the precious cultural content of Macau." The exhibition “Parallel Worlds” can be seen until November 23 this year at Arsenale, Campo Della Tana, Castello 2126/A, 30122, in Venice.

item.title: Beijing puts an end to the prohibition of Chinese companies to receive Boeing planes
item.description: China raised a ban that prevented Chinese airlines a month ago from receiving Boeing aircraft after commercial negotiations with the United States, which temporarily reduced the customs rights of each party. Beijing authorities have begun to inform domestic carriers and government agencies this week that aircraft deliveries in the United States may be resumed, according to Chinese sources in statements to Bloomberg on anonymity, because the information is confidential. Airlines were given freedom to organize deliveries in their own deadlines and conditions, one of the sources added. The resumption of deliveries to China is an immediate boost for Boeing. Defrosting occurs when the world's two largest economies agreed to a tariff truce, with the United States to reduce to 30 percent for 90 days their combined rates of 145 percent over most Chinese imports. China has agreed to reduce its 125 percent customs rights to US products to 10 percent and to eliminate other counterfeit against the United States since April 2. How long? Still, the restoration of aircraft deliveries may be short -term if the tariff war is not resolved during the three months of suspension. In this scenario, the American aeronautical giant based in Arlington, Virginia, will be able to see the price of its aircraft increase compared to its two main competitors, European Airbus and Commercial Aircraft Corporation of China (Comac), which seeks to gain land in the domestic market with state support. Boeing was spared the rates during the last episode of the trade war during the first presidency of Trump (2017-2021), but their sales to the Asian giant have been falling since 2019. In 2022, the expectation was that 25 percent of Boeing's international deliveries would go to China, but by 2023 the number dropped to 9 percent. On the other hand, experts believe that if the trade war is not stuck, the dispute will make US companies of all sectors higher prices for parts and raw materials that buy to China, which means they will face the double challenge of relocating part of their production and losing competitiveness in the Chinese market.

item.title: ANA CRISTINA ALVES
item.description: Ana Cristina Alves, auxiliary researcher and coordinator of the Educational Service of the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center May 2025 In Chinese Proverbial Lessons I went to discover great affinities between spontaneous Chinese popular philosophy, which runs from mouth to mouth, and the Christian proverbial wisdom, also made so that believers, in every corner of the globe, could memorize, repeat and disseminate. Nothing like the other's knowledge to bring and dispel prejudice, being one of the most usual that Chinese are extremely pragmatic and cold. But when we come across proverbs such as “love others as yourself,” in a direct translation and faithful to the original “爱人如己” (ài Rú Rú Jǐ), such leads us to think twice, it seems not to be here just a matter of respect, uncharged and formal, but rather a strong feeling for the other, not any, only a deep affection, of those we understand well that we are good, we will be well, we will be well, we will be well, we will be better. Then he runs a love of the Christian way for China without Christ ever been. Such finding can lead us to the assumption of the existence of universal structures, not only logical, including as regards affections, therefore sentimental. After all, selfishness may not be a dominant tendency, there is everything: selfish, aggressive and competitive people, as others will be naturally altruistic, compassionate and cooperatives, ready to recognize the universality of the feeling of love, which crosses borders rather than erecting them, bringing people closer to the most diverse social classes, ethnic groups, geographies, as in "love has no borders", in a direct translation "" (Àiqíng wú jiējí zhī fēn), here is particularly emphasized social borders. The content of the message gains full sense when one realizes that love to oneself takes place in a culture that many consider wrong and prejudiced only to focus on the whole, in the community. Attention to the person, the particular and the style and feeling of each, lives, in philosophies such as Taoist for centuries with the valorization of the collectivity, this ultimate tendency manifestly inculcated and worked by Confucianism. Love to itself, care for the individual body and mind, is emphasized in the so -called Proverbial “well -understood love and virtue must begin with us”, which has the following correspondence in Chinese “爱德从己起” (to Cong Jǐ qǐ). Anyone who imagines that in proverbial wisdom there is only place to praise and sing relational love, since the Chinese do not have any religious philosophy that chants spiritual love above all, in the Christian way of St. Augustine, will be surprised to find the following proverb "where there is no other gentleman", that in a direct translation of the Chinese is "the love above all" 爱情至上 爱情至上 爱情至上ZHì Shàng). If in doubt, there is another saying of complementary meaning and in which the idea of ​​the integrity and unity of this powerful affection, which moves mountains in the Christian sense, when it reads 爱情专一 （（（（iqíng zhuān yī）, in a possible translation "love cannot be broken", "one person cannot have a heart in two parts at the same time." From a psychological point of view, the acceptance of the other in loving terms will have to be complete, so their tastes, affections, relationships, and objects cannot be rejected, as is clear from the lesson "Who loves Beltrão, loves their dog", in a relative correspondence for "爱屋及乌" (ài wū jí wū), which in a literal translation would be "love the house and the crums." As is well known, proverbs are susceptible to various interpretations, so they say polysemic, but if they are perspective as a whole, and only then as pieces of a puzzle, there seems to be many doubts with regard to the proverb philosophy and psychology of Chinese love, which is echoed in the country's scholarly philosophies. In Chapter 67 of the Book of the road and virtue (《道德经》), also known by the name of the Patriarch of Taoism, Lazi (老子), is the first of the three guiding virtues of the Wise Way, Love, as you can read in the translation of Claudia Ribeiro (2004, 139): I have three treasures What entesouro and retains: The first is love (CI), The second frugality, The third is not daring to be the vanguard of the world. (…) For love, In combat, it triumphs, And in defense it is firm. The sky will come to aid And, with love, will protect (我有三寶/寶而持之/一曰慈/二曰儉/三曰不敢為天下先 (……) 夫慈以戰則勝//以守則固/以慈衛之 1) It is noted that while in proverbial philosophy the synogram used for love is 爱/愛 2 (AI), in the scholarly philosophy of the Patriarch of Taoism the term employment is 慈 (CI), that is, love with a strong relational and spiritual burden; Although they are different words, both refer to love, the first concerns the most physical and concrete feeling, centered on the heart of the person and the clutches that hold it; The second to that most relational and general indicates that love comes from inside the heart (内心 nèixīn), where it has the roots, emerging like any plant. However, the truth is that both terms focus on people, or rather in their hearts, affectionate connection with others, such a strong connection that draws the attention of heaven (天 tiān), maximum impersonal power, it ensures victory on all battle fronts, whether in the forefront or rear, when fighting and defended itself for love. Already the patriarch of Confucianism, Confucius (孔子), in the Chapter Twelve, later entitled the deep face, of the Analects (論語 • 颜渊第十二 ， 22) defines the main virtue of the school, benevolence or humanity, (仁 Rén) as an act of love to others, maintaining the term of the traditional vernacular 爱 (AI): “Fan Chi asked what was the benevolence was what answered, "love people". " (樊遲問仁 ， 子曰 「愛人 3。 ”) It is in this context of love of neighbor, which must be understood one of the main maxims of Confucian philosophy, which arises in the same chapter (論語 • 颜渊第十二 ， 2)“ Do not make to others what they do not want for you ”(己所不欲勿施於人 jǐ suǒ bù yù shunk yú rin). The essentials in Confucian philosophy will then guarantee love of others in terms of respect or humanity towards others, in order to ensure the normal functioning of society, without extreme sacrifices or exaggerated explorations, given to the proverb containment of confusion in relation to feelings, they are important and useful but should not extravate the boundaries of rationality, that is, even the best of them, will have to be measured, controlled and ritualized in the name of harmony collective. Therefore, the love that moves friendships, especially intellectuals, is the most praised, as we remembered at the end of this chapter (論語 • 颜渊第十二 ， 24): Zeng Zi stated: “A gentleman resorts to knowing to make friends and friends to cultivate benevolence4” (曾子曰：君以文會友 ， 以友輔仁。) Finally, also the Buddhist philosophy, especially from the Chan (禅 Chán) or Zen meditation line, praises the love of humanity, but indirectly, drawing attention to the heart and the identification of Buddha with the heart, the way of the Daoxin Patriarch (道信) and its maximum proverbially known “the heart is Buddha and Buddha is the heart” (非心不问佛 ， 问佛不非心 fēi xīn bùwèn fu, wèn fi bù fēi xīn). Here you come to love indirectly, only an enlightened heart can love the Buddha, as it is not surprising in the picture of this philosophy, after all what is Buddha but the very love that expresses itself not in a selfish, sick, self -centered heart, but in a heart capable of establishing relationships, healthy, altruistic and without empty, but not indifferent to the other? This confirms it the social and humanitarian actions of Via Mahayana Buddhism, which was accepted in China and unfolds in collective works such as the construction of educational institutions, hospitals, centers of social solidarity, in a proselytist action at all similar to the history of the Christian Church and its missionaries around the world. item.title: Osaka 2025 | Japanese architect Kengo Kuma considers it to be friendly with architecture
item.description: Japanese architect Kengo Kuma states in an interview with Lusa that she wanted to show the uniqueness between Portugal and Japan in the Portuguese Pavilion project at Expo 2025 Osaka and considers AI (artificial intelligence) friendly to architecture. Questionado sobre se a inteligência artificial (IA) é amiga ou inimiga da arquitetura, Kengo Kuma opta pela primeira opção. “Sim, é uma amiga”, até porque na verdade no processo de design “estamos a trabalhar com a IA”. Artificial intelligence “is a very strong team between us” and “we like to work” with this technology, he says. “We wanted to show the relationship with the ocean in Portugal,” says Kengo Kuma, when asked what was the project's inspiration. Portugal participates in Expo Osaka with the theme “Ocean, Blue Dialogue” and is located in the “Empowering Lives” zone, in a lot with 1,836.75 square meters, being close to the Japan Pavilion. The Kuma Kuma project expresses the dynamics of the ocean moment, using 9,972 suspended cables weighing more than 60 tons, and recycled networks to create a perennial effect and exposed to natural elements such as sun and wind, according to the organization. Sea connections The life of Portugal and Japan is “very close to the ocean”, in the sense that “we eat fish, we travel a lot through the oceans and history and life are closely linked to the ocean,” adds the architect. There is this “uniqueness of Portugal and Japan and we want to show” this similarity between the two countries. The volume of the Portugal Pavilion is characterized by a scenic facility that symbolizes the upper square suspended as a wave. "This design is very, very new to the history of art. We have long tried to use lines as a resource for navigation. With these lines, we try to show the beauty of natural phenomena," in the sea "we see natural light and breeze," he explains. “We tried to bring this kind of natural phenomenon to the Expo, perhaps the first attempt in the history of the expo to bring its own nature to the pavilion,” says the architect. About what will happen to the pavilion after finishing the Expo, the architect says he wants to bring the diversity of the project (which includes cables of various diameters and lengths) to different places. “I want to bring this diversity to different places” and “now we are planning to work with some artists” about it. Kengo Kuma said that the Slaughterhouse Project in Porto is completing and has two more projects in Portugal. The architect says he loves the side of the big cities in Portugal, but also the mountainous side and the ocean of the country. “We want to enjoy the diversity of Portugal,” he says. Create Memories Asked how can the more sustainable architecture become currently become, Kengo Kuma considers that "the most important for sustainability is to leave the memory of architecture forever." That is, "architecture, life, basically, are not so permanent." However, “we can leave the memory of architecture forever, which is the connection between architecture and humanity” and this “is the most important for sustainability,” he says. Used to comment on the controversy around his choice to project the Portuguese pavilion, the architect points out that he has an international office working in Portugal. "Maybe that's why we were invited," he concludes. Regarding the challenges that architecture currently faces, Kengo Kuma states that its cost is increasing “dramatically” and that everyone wants to reduce it. "But at the same time, people want to create a new monument" for this pillar. "And the cost and monumentality must walk together" today. Expo 2025 runs since April 13 and runs until October 13 on the artificial island of Yumeshima, located on the edge of Osaka, Kansai, Japan.

item.title: Church | Victims of sexual abuse want Leo XIV to assume theme
item.description:
One of the movement spokesmen that represents victims of sexual abuse in the Catholic Church yesterday asked Pope Leo XIV to put the theme as a priority and defines global rules to deal with cases. "Now that we have a new Latin American Pope should be given an example in all Latin American episcopades that, by decision and by the Pope, there can be no double standard" among the various Catholic hierarchies around the world, "said Argentine Sebastián Cuattromo, from the adult collective for the rights of the child. On the day the Pope made the first Sunday greeting in St. Peter's Square, praying Regina Caeli, a group of victims joined the square to ask the Vatican to impose common rules on the whole church. Cuattromo, 42, set an example of what is happening "in the first world societies and Latin America that acts as a Vatican backyard, where the same [repair] demands are not felt, such as they are felt before European public opinion." "As a survivor of childhood sexual abuse within the Catholic Church, with other companions survivors of this crime, we hope that the Pope will make an explicit mention of this question and an explicit reference to what he intends to do about it to pay off very large debts that, in our opinion, the Catholic Church still has to the victims," ​​said Cuattromo. “We victims broke the taboo, silence, denial, concealment, with our struggles, with a huge sacrifice, and reached a level of visibility in public opinion,” which forced the church to face the problem. Therefore, the global group of victims subscribed to a petition already delivered, in which they require “a true zero tolerance law that is established as canonical law”, which would “imply the immediate expulsion of the religious life of anyone involved in these acts”. Moreover, they propose a “Truth Commission that should not be directed by the Vatican, but by international human rights organizations with the United Nations standards and with which the Vatican would have to fully cooperate, freeing all the archives he has on the subject”. Finally, the victims intend a “justice process for the victims, where, among other things, there are concrete actions of reparation and justice for survivors around the world”, with the costs supported by the Church's own goods.
In the first person In his particular case, Sebastian Cuattromo filed an action against a religious from a Catholic school of Buenos Aires for sexual abuse and won the process in 2012, even before the election to the Pope of then Cardinal Bergoglio, archbishop of the Argentine capital. "Then the city's Catholic hierarchy was against the victims and supported the school, which intended to silence the victims of this offense through a private economic agreement," he recalled. "They made us feel a profound underestimation of the severity of the crime we were talking about," because, at that moment, "I was a young man who was fighting in solitude, with many doubts, with a lot less, with much anguish and felt an absolute lack of empathy and, instead, deep arrogance," he explained. After Francis' election, "I invited him publicly and privately to meet with the victims of his country, especially those who had bad experiences," but the Pope "never had the courage or sensitivity of calling us." For the new Pope, who is also accused of having ignored abuse complaints when he was a prior of the Augustinhos, Cuattromo expects Leo XIV to “assume this theme personally” and to be willing to “go to the last consequences”. Cardinal Robert Francis Prevost, 69, was elected Pope on Thursday after two days of Conclave, in the Vatican City, and took the name of Leo XIV.

item.description:

With regard to the “community engagement and investment” part, it is read that “more than $ 1.02 million for local companies and [NGO] non-governmental organizations in Macao through 21 SME events, with 603 SME and NGO participants” were generated. In addition, in the volunteering area, Melco points out that "about 3,600 participants offered their time and effort in more than 359 volunteering initiatives," "more than $ 17.42 million that were donated to decent causes in our communities." Quoted by the report, Lawrence Ho, Melco's president and executive director, says that "21 Heart of House initiatives and community events have generated more than $ 1 million for local companies in Macao, providing 603 SMEs and NGO opportunities to connect, expand and grow." According to the official, last year were "in -depth partnerships with PME and NGO". Regarding the relationship with local SMEs, Melco also highlights the connection with the supply chain, because “86 percent of acquisitions arose from local companies in Macao”, and of this total, “59 percent were local SME acquisitions”. Similar scenario occurred in the other operators that Melco holds in Cyprus and Manila, with local acquisitions around 40 and 76 percent, respectively. In addition, "over 758,000 participants have attended more than 1,400 courses offered by" Melco Learning Academy ", which is equivalent to over 870,000 hours of learning." Also noteworthy is that, in all Melco projects, "women represent 23 percent of the boards of business and 32 percent of the higher paintings." The report also tells that “63 percent of positions at the vice-presidency level, or above this post, were filled from local communities, increasing to 70 percent in Macao”, can read. All for the environment Another of the areas highlighted in Melco's sustainability report concerns environmental policies. "In 2024, despite an increase of 39 percent in terms of the number of visitors and the rise of 19 percent in the occupation rate of the hotel rooms, along with the addition of a property and a new resort integrated into our portfolio, the energy intensity increased by 10 percent from 2023, but was 19 percent lower than our year of reference 2019." In terms of water consumption, the report indicates that “despite the increase in the number of visitors and the hotel occupancy rate”, “total water consumption and water intensity increased only 6 and 2 percent compared to 2023, respectively, and were 6 and 30 percent lower, respectively, to the 2019 reference year”. However, this is a goal that, according to the company, is still "in progress". Another objective highlighted in the report was the “annual economy of over 510,820 cubic meters of water through water efficiency measures, an increase of 10 percent compared to 2023 ″. "As we invest in people and communities, we continue to derive environmental efforts with the same determination. (…) The intensity of energy and water consumption, as well as greenhouse gas emissions, remained significantly below our 2019 base line, even adding a new property and an integrated resort," says Lawrence Ho. The entrepreneur also referred to the increase "of the amount of valuable materials diverted through recycling and composting in global operations - 58 percent over last year." “In our restoration spaces we also fight food waste, with the 'clean dish challenge' to contribute to a 9 percent reduction in waste in the Macao and Manila restoration areas.” “Mentality change” For Lawrence Ho, greater sustainability in Melco requires "a change of mindset" verified in "small actions that, on scale, can have a significant impact." Regarding the supply chain of the group's integrated hotels and resorts, good results are also highlighted. "Although the numbers do not always show exponential heels, our focus on responsible supply remains unwavering, 18 percent of all seafood bought by weight to be sustainable sources, and 100 percent of our food and drink points in Macao and Manila to serve eggs of outdoor chickens," he reads. There is thus "an effort that reflects a deeper ambition to incorporate sustainability into acquisitions," said Lawrence Ho, who added that "more than one service, hospitality has to do with the experience it creates, the people it supports and the impact it leaves." “Every year, Melco challenges himself to go further, believing that luxury and responsibility are not opposite forces, but partners in progress, which is reflected in the way we defend strong governance, we manage our environmental impact, we support our people and communities and lead the responsible game. This commitment to progress shaped our approach in 2024, as a year of recalibration in which we continue to strengthen operations, operations, rekindle the impetus and ensure that our integrated resorts remain at the forefront of excellence, ”he concluded.

item.description:
The week has started atypically on the Iberian Peninsula. It was a few minutes from 11:30 am on Monday, when a widespread electricity failure paralyzed Portugal and Spain. Only near 23h the light returned to the Portuguese house, but the dropper
It was an apparent normal Monday, but this normality dissipated late in the morning with the electricity failure that gradually led to communication failures and impossibility of using mobile data. Portugal and Spain were without electricity for too many hours on Monday, an unprecedented episode in terms of energy failures. In the case of Lisbon, the light began to fail a few minutes after 11:30 am, followed by the impossibility of communication via mobile data. Traffic in the center of the Portuguese capital became chaotic, without traffic lights in operation, generating some road accidents. Supermarkets, cafes and restaurants, with no possibility of maintaining normal operation and food properly refrigerated, closed doors. Many people, frightened by the possibility of staying several days without light, ran to supermarkets, sagging canned foods, water carboys, candles and batteries. In addition to the unusual constraints in people's daily lives, with the suddenly closed meter and congested transport, there were suspended flights and closed airports. The restoration of energy took place gradually throughout Monday, starting with the Center of Portugal. The circulation in the Lisbon Metropolitan (ML) was resumed at all at 08:38, Lisbon time, first in the blue and red lines at 08h, in yellow at 08:15 and green at 08:38. "The Lisbon Metropolitano had a vast team working yesterday night [Monday] and today's dawn [Tuesday] to ensure the replacement of operating systems affected by the widespread energy failure yesterday," ML said in a statement. Government words In a note issued by the Portuguese government in the early hours of yesterday morning, it was said that there were already “virtually all services, including the supply of energy, restored,” Presidential Minister António Leitão Amaro told Lusa. According to the minister, all 6.4 million customers had already access to electricity in the early hours of Tuesday morning, except 800 who had faults not related to blackout. Leitão Amaro also said that water supply is working throughout the country, with only a few pressure difficulties in "two or three municipalities" that will be "resolved quickly". Regarding transportation, the minister said that the "trains are working", and it is still necessary to stabilize some points of the operation, but due to the effects of 24 hours strike that took place on Monday. About airports, “are operational,” said Leitão Amaro, recognizing that in the case of Lisbon airport, which was the most affected by energy failure and should take two days [to this day] to have stabilized flows, although the systems are all operational. Normalized Schools and Health The Portuguese ruler also said that, in relation to schools, the guidance issued at dawn to all directors was to open and function normally, except for cases where there may be some specific security ratio. "The supply of fuels is normalized and did not record, at night, relevant occurrences of safety or civil protection" in the country, advanced Leitão Amaro, stressing that the situation is also stabilized in health services. "Hospitals and health centers are in terms of supply and supply to function normally," he said. "At this time, what we can say is that [energy] systems are stabilized, both in transportation and consumers supply," said the presidency minister. In Spain there were also several embarrassment, especially at the level of transport. Pedro Sánchez, Spanish Prime Minister, said on Monday, quoted by Lusa, that this episode was unprecedented in the country. The ruler spoke to the country after the second meeting of Spain National Security Council. "All potential causes are analyzed without discarding any hypothesis," he added. Gigawatts loss The Spanish government leader revealed that, according to the technicians and experts of the Spanish power grid, 15 generation gigawatts "suddenly lost the system in just five seconds, something that had never happened." According to explained, to give a dimension of the event, 15 kilowatts of generation correspond to approximately looking for total electricity in the country at the time of blackout (12:33 in Spain, 11h33 in Lisbon). "What has caused this sudden disappearance of supply" is something that experts cannot yet explain, he added. In the early hours after the blackout, information began to circulate on a possible cyberathel who never confirmed. A few hours after the blackout, Ursula Von Der Leyen, president of the European Commission, said on the LinkedIn social network that he had spoken with the prime ministers Pedro Sánchez and Luís Montenegro about the monitoring of the case. “I reaffirmed that the European Commission has supported and monitored the situation with national and European authorities and together with our electricity coordination group. We will gather efforts and share information to help restore the electricity supply system, agreeing to maintain narrow contact,” reads one of the publications. Eduardo Prieto, head of operations at Spanish Red Electric, told the Associated Press that the situation was not preceded by something “exceptional and extraordinary”. One of the possible causes pointed to the blackout is a rare atmospheric phenomenon, referred to as “induced atmospheric vibration”, which may have originated “anomalous oscillations” in the high voltage lines of the Spanish energy network. "These oscillations have caused synchronization failures between electrical systems, leading to successive disturbances in interconnected European networks," the Portuguese Energy company Ren to BBC told Monday afternoon. But later Ren denied this information. Many issues Another causes may have been technical problems in the electric network itself. Onyema NDUKA, a full -sustainability professor of energy sustainability at the University of London, said electric networks are usually interconnected because the production centers that feed them are located far from cities. This means that a power cut in a part of the grid can "lead to a waterfall effect in other areas." "Ideally, redundancies are incorporated into the system, such as having several supply points, reserve generators located in different locations, wires and interconnected cables, etc.," he said. The solution is through energy companies to restore electricity to affected customers as soon as possible, but the procedure for doing so “has not yet been revealed,” added NDUKA. The Portuguese authorities, cited by the AP and the local media, have so far attributed the failure of energy to unspecified technical problems, originating outside the country, but mentioned that the investigation is still underway. The possibility of a cyberatoque is, for now, away. “Spain has mechanisms to deal with this kind of situations. Once again, I appeal to citizens to collaborate with all authorities and act responsibly and civilly, as we have always done,” wrote Pedro Sánchez on social networks. The Portuguese National Cyberrseness Center also stated in a statement that there is no evidence that the failure was caused by a computer attack. Speaking to Euronews, Taco Engelaar, Neara Director-General, a specialist in energy infrastructure, said the interconnectivity of national networks and their systems would mean that a failure or attack would have the same net result. "Such a widespread failure of the network is extremely unusual and can be caused by a number of factors: a physical failure on the network that provokes the power cut, a coordinated cybercar or a dramatic imbalance between demand and the supply that has made the network system exceeds the boundaries," he said. "If it is a system failure, then the interconnectivity between the different regional and national networks can lead to the large amount of power cuts we are watching today [Monday]," he added. "The same applies to a cybership - many of these systems are linked and sharing assets - to overthrow one can overthrow many," he said. With agencies

item.description:

item.title: Commerce | Chief Executive wants more Lusophone investors
item.description:
Sam Hou Fai, head of the executive, said yesterday that Macau intends to attract more investors from countries where Portuguese is spoken in order to streamline the local economy and promote the longed for “economic diversification”
Macao government leader Sam Hou Fai said today that the region wants to attract more foreign investors, including Portuguese -speaking countries. At a press conference, the chief executive said that the territory has to “welcome foreign friends to invest in Macau and also to realize his dreams in Macao”, especially in the area of ​​advanced technology. Sam Hou Fai stressed that "they can come from Portuguese and Spanish-speaking countries", because "as long as they are in favor of economic diversification, they are always welcome," he added. Sam argued that local entrepreneurs should "explore Spanish and Portuguese language markets and Africa markets and the Middle East." The chief executive stressed that this is “the role of Macao on the international stage”, awarded by the Chinese central government. “We have to know what our advantages are and promote our course of development abroad,” said Sam. Visit to Portugal in July In a statement issued Monday night, the leader had already appealed to the city's industrial and commercial sector to "attract more investments from foreign capital and concentrate on Macao more resources [human] of high quality." Local entrepreneurs should “take full advantage of the singular role and the unique advantages of Macao” to “actively explore priority markets, such as those of Portuguese -speaking countries,” added the government leader. On April 14, Sam said he will visit Portugal after the May 18 legislatures, but offered no solution to restrictions on the Portuguese residence in the region. Macau has not accepted since August 2023 new requests for residence for Portuguese, for the “exercise of specialized technical functions”, allowing only justification of family meeting or previous connection to the territory. The Portuguese remains the issuance of a 'Blue Card', a limited authorization to the labor bond, without the benefits of residents, namely at the level of health or education. Yesterday the government leader said that the visit to Portugal "should be in July" and could include a time in Spain, "to find more development projects between Macau and these countries." Sam said the Macao delegation will include entrepreneurs from the region's industrial, commercial and financial sectors and "even certain companies in the interior of China."
